meanings.definition: To refuse to comply or cooperate.
meanings.sent1: She always jibs at doing her chores.
meanings.sent2: The child jibs at eating his vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The cat jibs at taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine jibs at starting in the cold.
meanings.sent5: The student jibs at studying for the test.

meanings.definition: The triangular staysail set forward of the foremast of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The sailors adjusted the jibs to catch the wind.
meanings.sent2: The captain raised the jibs to increase speed.
meanings.sent3: The jibs fluttered in the breeze like colorful flags.
meanings.sent4: The jibs billowed out as the ship sailed into the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The crew secured the jibs before the storm hit.

meanings.definition: A projecting arm on a crane or derrick.
meanings.sent1: The crane operator extended the jibs to reach the rooftop.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers attached the load to the jibs.
meanings.sent3: The jibs swung gracefully as the crane moved.
meanings.sent4: The jibs loomed over the construction site like giant arms.
meanings.sent5: The jibs lifted the heavy materials effortlessly.
